subject: Re: what's the differences between Shavian and Read
msgSnippet: The differeces between three Read scripts can be seen in a side by side comparision at http://groups.yahoo.com/group/Read_Alphabet/files/gp/readscripts.gif
messageBody:
The differeces between three Read scripts can be seen in a side by
side comparision at
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/Read_Alphabet/files/gp/readscripts.gif

--Steve

--- satnordameriko wrote:

> > and what were the problems with Shavian?

--- page wrote:
> QS is simplified a little from Shavian.
> An example is that he deleted the accented schwa symbol.

SB: The initial vowel in <up> and <ago> are written the same way.

> PG: Quikscript is strongly cursive although letters are attached
> only when one letter naturally leads into another

> Shavian letters, on the other hand, are not connected.

--- satnordameriko wrote:

> > and what were the problems with Shavian?

--- page wrote:
> QS is simplified a little from Shavian.  
> An example is that he deleted the accented schwa symbol.

SB:  The initial vowel in <up> and <ago> are written the same way.
 
> PG: Quikscript is strongly cursive although letters are attached 
> only when one letter naturally leads into another 

>  Shavian letters, on the other hand, are not connected.
